context: Alternatively, recovery from convulsions might result from an increase production of the NMDA antagonist kynurenic acid by the kynurenine pathway. Kynurenic acid production logically would be increased via stimulation of indole amine 2,3-dioxygenase by oxygen and through build-up of its substrate kynurenine because of pathway inhibition at 3HAO. The brain concentration of 3HAA is not known precisely but like related kynurenine pathway intermediates it may be near 1 μM in the physiologically normal brain. However, the 3HAA concentration at the intracellular brain site of 3HAO and how it may vary (possibly increase) during oxygen poisoning of the kynurenine pathway during HBO, is unknown. Iron analysis The mechanism by which HBO inactivates 3HAO in vitro is of interest. Lower enzyme activity might occur through oxidizing Fe2+ to Fe3+ in the activating mixture and/or by oxidizing the Fe2+ ions attached to the enzyme molecule itself. If the lower enzyme activity was due to the lower concentration of Fe2+ in the reaction mixture, then when fresh Fe2+ subsequently was added to the HBO exposed reaction mixture, the specific activity should increase significantly but it did not (Table 2).
